first_reading.text:
[[Rm 11,29]]Brothers and sisters: The gifts and the call of God are irrevocable.
[[Rm 11,30]]Just as you once disobeyed God but have now received mercy because of their disobedience,
[[Rm 11,31]]so they have now disobeyed in order that, by virtue of the mercy shown to you, they too may (now) receive mercy.
[[Rm 11,32]]For God delivered all to disobedience, that he might have mercy upon all.
[[Rm 11,33]]Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How inscrutable are his judgments and how unsearchable his ways!
[[Rm 11,34]]"For who has known the mind of the Lord or who has been his counselor?"
[[Rm 11,35]]"Or who has given him anything that he may be repaid?"
[[Rm 11,36]]For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be glory forever. Amen.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 69,30]]I am afflicted and in pain; 
let your saving help, O God, protect me.
[[Ps 69,31]]I will praise the name of God in song, 
and I will glorify him with thanksgiving.

[[Ps 69,33]]“See, you lowly ones, and be glad; 
you who seek God, may your hearts revive!
[[Ps 69,34]]For the LORD hears the poor, 
and his own who are in bonds he spurns not.”

[[Ps 69,36]]For God will save Zion 
and rebuild the cities of Judah.
[[Ps 69,37]]They shall dwell in the land and own it,
and the descendants of his servants shall inherit it,
and those who love his name shall inhabit it.
psalm.title: Psalms
